channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC

item.title: Report X-2024110508
item.description:
Report X-2024110508

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-09
  • City: SPARTANBURG
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Lead acid battery with non-hazmat return label found leaking in tote. Unknown what happened to packaging. Based on SPIDR images, battery shipped in non-UN POP Home Depot box without any hazmat labels or markings.

item.title: Report X-2024110410
item.description:
Report X-2024110410

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-01
  • City: WEST COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the CAER location a dented drum was presented to the spill office as a possible undeclared shipment. While investigating the shipment the spill agent found a SDS stating the product as UN1999 class3. There were no DG markings on the metal bucket are paperwork needed for transport. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.
